    • Method Detail

      • createConnection

        public TGConnection createConnection(java.lang.String url,
                                     java.lang.String userName,
                                     java.lang.String password,
                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env)
                              throws TGException
        Description copied from class: TGConnectionFactory
        Create a connection on the url using the name and password Each connection will create a dedicated Channel for connection.
        Specified by:
        createConnection in class TGConnectionFactory
        Parameters:
        url - The url for connection. A URL is represented as a string of the form
        <protocol>://[user@]['['ipv6']'] | ipv4 [:][port][/]'{' name:value;... '}'
        protocol can be tcp or ssl.
        For ssl protocol, the following properties must also be present
        dbName:the database name
        verifyDBName:true

        userName - The user name for connection. The userId provided overrides all other userIds that can be infered. The rules for overriding are in this order
        a. The argument 'userId' is the highest priority. If Null then
        b. The user@url is considered. If that is Null
        c. the "userID=value" from the URL string is considered.
        d. If all of them is Null, then the default User associated to the installation will be taken.

        password - The managled or unmanagled password
        env - optional environment. This environment will override every other environment values infered, and is specific for this connection only. The following properties are supported
        Connection Properties
        Full Name Alias Default Value Description
        tgdb.channel.defaultHost - localhost The default host specifier
        tgdb.channel.defaultPort - 8700 The default port specifier
        tgdb.channel.defaultProtocol - tcp The default protocol
        tgdb.channel.sendSize sendSize 122 TCP send packet size in KBs
        tgdb.channel.recvSize recvSize 128 TCP recv packet size in KB
        tgdb.channel.pingInterval pingInterval 30 Keep alive ping intervals
        tgdb.channel.connectTimeout connectTimeout 1000 Timeout for connection to establish, before it gives up and tries the ftUrls if specified
        tgdb.channel.ftHosts ftHosts - Alternate fault tolerant list of <host:port> pair seperated by comma.
        tgdb.channel.ftRetryIntervalSeconds ftRetryIntervalSeconds 10 The connect retry interval to ftHosts
        tgdb.channel.ftRetryCount ftRetryCount 3 The number of times ro retry
        tgdb.channel.defaultUserID - - The default user Id for the connection
        tgdb.channel.userID userID - The user id for the connection if it is not specified in the API. See the rules for picking the user name
        tgdb.channel.password password - The password for the username
        tgdb.channel.clientId clientId tgdb.java-api.client The client id to be used for the connection
        tgdb.connection.dbName dbName - The database name the client is connecting to. It is used as part of verification for ssl channels
        tgdb.connectionpool.useDedicatedChannelPerConnection useDedicatedChannelPerConnection false A boolean value indicating either to multiplex mulitple connections on a single tcp socket or use dedicate socket per connection. A true value consumes resource but provides good performance. Also check the max number of connections
        tgdb.connectionpool.defaultPoolSize defaultPoolSize 10 The default connection pool size to use when creating a ConnectionPool
        tgdb.connectionpool.connectionReserveTimeoutSeconds connectionReserveTimeoutSeconds 10 A timeout parameter indicating how long to wait before getting a connection from the pool
        tgdb.connection.operationTimeoutSeconds connectionOperationTimeoutSeconds 10 A timeout parameter indicating how long to wait for a operation before giving up. Some queries are long running, and may override this behavior.
        tgdb.tls.provider.name tlsProviderName SunJSSE Transport level Security provider. Work with your InfoSec team to change this value
        tgdb.tls.provider.className tlsProviderClassName com.sun.net.ssl.internal.ssl.Provider The underlying Provider implementation. Work with your InfoSec team to change this value.
        tgdb.tls.provider.configFile tlsProviderConfigFile - Some providers require extra configuration paramters, and it can be passed as a file
        tgdb.tls.protocol tlsProtocol TLSv1.2 tlsProtocol version. The system only supports 1.2+
        tgdb.tls.cipherSuites cipherSuites - A list cipher suites that the InfoSec team has cleared. The default list is a common list of JSSE's cipher list and Openssl list that supports 1.2 protocol
        tgdb.tls.verifyDBName verifyDBName false Verify the Database name in the certificate. TGDB provides self signed certificate for easy-to-use SSL.
        tgdb.tls.expectedHostName expectedHostName - The expected hostName for the certificate. This is for future use
        tgdb.tls.trustedCertificates trustedCertificates - The list of trusted Certificates
        tgdb.security.keyStorePassword keyStorePassword - The Keystore for the password
        Returns:
        TGConnection - an instance of connection to the server with a dedicated channel
        Throws:
        TGException - - If it cannot create a connection to the server successfully

      • createConnectionPool

        public TGConnectionPool createConnectionPool(java.lang.String url,
                                             java.lang.String userName,
                                             java.lang.String password,
                                             int poolSize,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env)
                                      throws TGException
        Description copied from class: TGConnectionFactory
        Create a Connection Pool of pool size on the the url using the name and password. Each connection in the pool will default use a shared channel, but this can be overriden by setting the value property tgdb.connectionpool.useDedicatedChannel=true
        Specified by:
        createConnectionPool in class TGConnectionFactory
        Parameters:
        url - The url for the channel used in the connection pool.
        userName - The user name for connection.
        password - The password mangled or unmangled
        poolSize - the size of the pool
        env - optional environment. This environment will override every other environment values infered, and is specific for this pool only
        Returns:
        A Connection Pool
        Throws:
        TGException - - If it cannot create a connectionpool to the server successfully
        See Also:
        TGConnectionFactory.createConnection(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.util.Map)
